data.title: Downloadable Anne McCaffrey Author Sampler - Fulton County Library System
data.meta_description:
Downloadable Anne McCaffrey Author Sampler by FCLSeResources - a staff-created list : Indulge in some retro science fiction and fantasy by the first woman to win a Hugo and the first woman to win a Nebula. While much of her backlist has yet to be made available for libraries to license, this sampler contains some real gems, as well as collaborations with other masters of genre including Elizabeth Moon, Margaret Ball, Jody Lynn Nye, Mercedes Lackey and more!

McCaffrey was best known for her series The Dragonriders of Pern. The two novellas included in the first novel, Dragonflight, were the ones that put McCaffrey in the Science Fiction pantheon. The rest of the series made her a fixture on bestseller lists in the 1980's and 1990's. Only books 1-3 (Dragonflight, Dragonquest, and The White Dragon) of The Dragonriders of Pern are available to library patrons as eBooks. Only a handful of the eAudiobooks from the series are available; the two most popular are on this list.

McCaffrey often visited Atlanta for DragonCon, and was known to locals in her later years for her dedication to riding a mobility scooter at high speed through Peachtree Center without apology to others who might be in her way. Many Atlanta Science Fiction and Fantasy fans have an "Anne McCaffrey Story", and no small percentage of those involve toes or shoes run over (this is considered a local badge of honor). Her son, Todd J. McCaffrey, has continued some of his mother's series as well as publishing his own works.

Not everything about this series has aged well, but it remains a notable work of late 20th century Science Fiction. While this book is the second Brainship book, it stands on its own!
